# The `ValueLatticeElement` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class represents lattice values for constants. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This class represents lattice values for constants.

FIXME: This is basically just for bringup, this can be made a lot more rich in the future.

This <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> has no known value yet

<EnumerationListItem name="undef">
This <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> is an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/undefvalue">UndefValue</a> constant or produces undef
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a2016050bbc67219751cea3c3a7029434a14f6419cdef20574c66249a990ac99f1" />
<EnumerationListItem name="constant">
This <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> has a specific constant value
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a2016050bbc67219751cea3c3a7029434aa201a33487fa062d8cd615aa81beb442" />
<EnumerationListItem name="notconstant">
This <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> is known to not have the specified value
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a2016050bbc67219751cea3c3a7029434ab29cd0c72da347e0569dd45581e17834" />
<EnumerationListItem name="constantrange">
The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> falls within this range
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a2016050bbc67219751cea3c3a7029434a73cfb84a2f173fabc28406d6b4f5b5ed" />
<EnumerationListItem name="constantrange_including_undef">
This <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> falls within this range, but also may be undef
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a2016050bbc67219751cea3c3a7029434ad7904e4577e98ebfacaa783287d321e9" />
<EnumerationListItem name="overdefined">
We can not precisely model the dynamic values this value might take
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

### getConstantRange() {#a73e8c58e4d729c42b5f27e3d847c54f8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const ConstantRange &amp; llvm::ValueLatticeElement::getConstantRange (bool UndefAllowed=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the constant range for this value.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> <code>UndefAllowed</code> to exclude non-singleton constant ranges that may also be undef. Note that this function also returns a range if the range may include undef, but only contains a single element. In that case, it can be replaced by a constant.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/valuelattice-h/#l00266">266</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/valuelattice-h">ValueLattice.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### intersect() {#a975cd575019795ff8714252a22f27c26}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ValueLatticeElement llvm::ValueLatticeElement::intersect (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuelatticeelement">ValueLatticeElement</a> &amp; Other) const</>}>
Combine two sets of facts about the same value into a single set of facts.

Note that this method is not suitable for merging facts along different paths in a CFG; that&#39;s what the mergeIn function is for. This is for merging facts gathered about the same value at the same location through two independent means. Notes:
<ul>
<li>This method does not promise to return the most precise possible lattice value implied by A and B. It is allowed to return any lattice element which is at least as strong as <em>either</em> A or B (unless our facts conflict, see below).</li>
<li>Due to unreachable code, the intersection of two lattice values could be contradictory. If this happens, we return some valid lattice value so as not confuse the rest of LVI. Ideally, we&#39;d always return Undefined, but we do not make this guarantee. TODO: This would be a useful enhancement.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/valuelattice-h/#l00489">489</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/valuelattice-h">ValueLattice.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/valuelattice-cpp/#l00078">78</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/valuelattice-cpp">ValueLattice.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isConstantRange() {#a7ab774f05d02e4bbe7817798cdf19186}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::ValueLatticeElement::isConstantRange (bool UndefAllowed=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns true if this value is a constant range.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> <code>UndefAllowed</code> to exclude non-singleton constant ranges that may also be undef. Note that this function also returns true if the range may include undef, but only contains a single element. In that case, it can be replaced by a constant.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/valuelattice-h/#l00246">246</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/valuelattice-h">ValueLattice.h</a>.

### markConstant() {#adcc7b385c19a2f07a57bf7351ce25d90}

### markConstantRange() {#afbd26f64ed2e22a81bf690e93aa121a0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::ValueLatticeElement::markConstantRange (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> NewR, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/valuelatticeelement/mergeoptions">MergeOptions</a> Opts=<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/valuelatticeelement/mergeoptions">MergeOptions</a>())</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Mark the object as constant range with <code>NewR</code>.

If the object is already a constant range, nothing changes if the existing range is equal to <code>NewR</code> and the tag. Otherwise <code>NewR</code> must be a superset of the existing range or the object must be undef. The tag is set to constant&#95;range&#95;including&#95;undef if either the existing value or the new range may include undef.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/valuelattice-h/#l00359">359</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/valuelattice-h">ValueLattice.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

###  {#a50b4e339429703558421cc2e66a09cdd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="union llvm::ValueLatticeElement llvm::ValueLatticeElement">
The union either stores a pointer to a constant or a constant range, associated to the lattice element.

We have to ensure that Range is initialized or destroyed when changing state to or from constantrange.
